283003. Reunification of Pomerania

Stettin — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Pommern
  • The following must not occur:
    • Pomerania exists

Will happen within 100 days of January 2, 1419
Checked again every 100 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

Pomerania is reunified.

Actions

A. Pomerania is one again

  • Pommern will be considered a claim province
  • Flag graphics set to default
  • Become Pomerania
  • +50 victory points
  • Centralization +2
  • Flag graphics extension set to "Stettin"
  • Set flag [Stettin] for events

Back to top

283004. Unrest in Stettin

Stettin — Not random

Will happen within 300 days of January 2, 1428
Checked again every 300 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1428)

Description

Discontent with the city authorities, two members of the Stettin city council agitated the citizenry into overthrowing the council and installing a new one. Unable to tolerate this act and keen on taking advantage of it, Duke Casimir of Pomerania-Stettin seized the city and captured the troublemakers. He held a harsh tribunal, had the two ringleaders executed in public, restored the town council, ordered the city to pay damages and renounced several of its privileges. The result of this was a notable consolidation of Ducal authority in the rich hanseatic city.

Actions

A. Punish the traitors harshly

  • Centralization +1
  • +1 base tax value in the capital province
  • Stability +1
  • The capital province revolts

B. Be merciful

  • Serfdom -1
  • Stability -1
  • Global revolt risk +3 for 12 months

Back to top

283005. Death of Duke Joachim

Stettin — Not random

Conditions

  • Brandenburg exists
  • None of the following must occur:
    • Brandenburg is a vassal of Stettin
    • Stettin and Brandenburg are at war

Will happen on September 23, 1451

Description

Duke Joachim of Stettin died prematurely of the plague in 1451, with his son and heir Otto still a minor. His mother Elisabeth, a daughter of Margrave Johann of Brandenburg, took the regency while his uncle Friedrich II of Brandenburg became his guardian. Thus Pomerania-Stettin was effectively controlled by the Hohenzollern for a decade.

Actions

A. Accept Friedrich of Brandenburg as guardian

  • +200 relations with Brandenburg
  • Stability +2
  • Event 132020 - Regency in Pomerania-Stettin for Brandenburg is triggered immediately
  • Set flag [Regency] for events

Back to top

283006. Duke Otto takes control of his country

Stettin — Not random

Conditions

  • Flag [Regency] is set
  • Stettin is a vassal of Brandenburg

Will happen within 100 days of January 2, 1460
Checked again every 100 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after May 29, 1460)

Description

In 1460, at the age of 15, Otto III took control of the Duchy of Pomerania-Stettin, ending the regency of his mother and Brandenburg's strong influence on his country.

Actions

A. OK

  • Break vassalization with Brandenburg
  • Stability +3

Back to top

283000. The succession in Pomerania-Stettin

Stettin — Not random

Conditions

  • Pomerania exists
  • Brandenburg exists

Will happen on September 12, 1464

Description

Otto III of Pomerania-Stettin died of the plague in 1464, without an heir. Both his relatives in Pomerania-Wolgast - the Dukes Erich II and Wartislaw IX - and his feudal overlord, the Elector of Brandenburg, claimed the inheritance. After several years of struggling, Erich of Pomerania-Wolgast secured the inheritance against Brandenburg's claims, however had to accept its feudal suzerainty. After multiple divisions, most of Pomerania was then united again under Erich, and his son Bogislaw obtained the rest, becoming Duke of all of Pomerania.

Actions

A. Pomerania-Wolgast (End Game)

  • Event 259000 - Inheritance of Pomerania-Stettin for Pomerania is triggered immediately

B. Brandenburg (End Game)

  • Event 132018 - Inheritance of Stettin for Brandenburg is triggered immediately

C. Freedom!

  • Centralization -2
  • Stability -4
  • Global revolt risk +5 for 120 months

Back to top

283001. The succession in Pomerania-Stettin

Stettin — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Pomerania exists

Will happen on September 12, 1464

Description

Otto III of Pomerania-Stettin died of the plague in 1464, without an heir. Both his relatives in Pomerania-Wolgast - the Dukes Erich II and Wartislaw IX - and his feudal overlord, the Elector of Brandenburg, claimed the inheritance. After several years of struggling, Erich of Pomerania-Wolgast secured the inheritance against Brandenburg's claims, however had to accept its feudal suzerainty. After multiple divisions, most of Pomerania was then united again under Erich, and his son Bogislaw obtained the rest, becoming Duke of all of Pomerania.

Actions

A. Pomerania-Wolgast

  • Pommern will be considered a claim province
  • -50 relations with Brandenburg
  • Flag graphics set to default
  • Become Pomerania
  • Flag graphics extension set to "Stettin"
  • Set flag [Stettin] for events

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Pomerania exists

Will happen on December 17, 1478

Description

Wartislaw X died in 1478 without an heir. Bogislaw claimed the inheritance.

Actions

A. Pomerania-Wolgast

  • Pommern will be considered a claim province
  • Flag graphics set to default

  • Flag graphics extension set to "Stettin"

Conditions

  • Centralization -2
  • Stability -4
  • Global revolt risk +5 for 120 months
